pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:0.5: 8. The training rule on disposing of feces
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.1: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.2: a brahmin who had earned money by working for the king thought, “I’ll ask for my wages.” After washing his hair, he walked past the nuns’ dwelling place on his way to the king’s residence.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.3: Just then, after defecating in a pot, a nun disposed of the feces over a wall, and it landed on the head of that brahmin.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.4: He complained and criticized the nuns,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.6: How can they dump shit on my head?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.7: I’m gonna burn down their dwelling place!”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.8: And he got hold of a firebrand and entered their dwelling place.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.9: Just then a lay follower who was coming out from the nuns’ dwelling place saw that brahmin with a firebrand on his way in,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.11: “Sir, why are you entering the nuns’ dwelling place with a firebrand?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.12: “These shaven-headed sluts dumped shit on my head.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.13: I’m gonna burn down their dwelling place!”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.15: You’ll get your wages and a thousand coins in addition.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.16: That brahmin then washed his hair, went to the king’s residence, and he got his wages and a thousand coins in addition.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.17: But that lay follower returned to the nuns’ dwelling place, told them what had happened, and then scolded them.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.18: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized them,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.19: “How can nuns dispose of feces over a wall?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.20: “Is it true, monks, that nuns do this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.23: “How can nuns dispose of feces over a wall?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.25: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:1.26.1: ‘If a nun disposes of feces or urine or trash or food scraps over a wall or over an encircling wall, or she has it disposed of in this way, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.12: food remnants or bones or used water.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.14: there are three kinds of walls: walls made of bricks, walls made of stone, walls made of wood.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.16: there are three kinds of encircling walls: encircling walls made of bricks, encircling walls made of stone, encircling walls made of wood.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.18: to the other side of the wall.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.20: to the other side of the encircling wall.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.22: if she disposes of it herself, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.24: in asking another, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.1.25: If she only asks once, then even if the other disposes of such things many times, she commits one offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.2.2: if she disposes of it after having looked;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.2.3: if she disposes of it at a place where no one passes by;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.2.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc8:2.2.6: The eighth training rule is finished.
